programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 7 Alabama (23-7, 12-5) dropped its last two games, but leads the country in scoring, averaging 91.1 ppg behind Mark Sears; No. 1 Auburn (27-3, 15-2) had its six-win streak snapped by Texas A&M, 83-72, but beat Alabama, 94-85, on Feb. 15.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Duke (27-3, 18-1) won seven-straight games, and beat the Tar Heels, 87-70, on Feb. 1 behind 22 points from Kon Knueppel and 21 points from Cooper Flagg; North Carolina (20-11, 13-6) won its last six games, and is 12-2 at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 24 Arizona (20-10, 14-5) split its last eight games after a 113-100 win over rival Arizona State; Kansas (19-11, 10-9) dropped four of its last six, but is 13-3 at home behind Hunter Dickinson, who is fourth in Big 12 scoring at 16.9 ppg.

programme.desc: Documentary shorts detailing intriguing sports stories that captured the public's imagination or have been largely overlooked with the passage of time; various directors have creative control over the films that recount major events.

programme.title: Nine for IX
programme.desc: Pat Summitt, the NCAA's winningest women's basketball coach, became a legend at the University of Tennessee before she stepped down from her position with early-onset Alzheimer's; athletes and associates reflect on how Summitt influenced their lives.

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts
programme.desc: Hand games have become a staple of young Black girls dating back generations, as the documentary traces the history of the games and the influence they have had on pop culture and the creative landscape, including music, dance and style.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgetown (17-13, 8-11) ended a three-game skid with a 75-73 win over Villanova; DePaul (12-18, 3-16) ended a six-game skid with an 80-77 win over Providence, and defeated the Hoyas, 73-68, on Jan. 17 behind 17 points from CJ Gunn.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Providence (12-18, 6-13) dropped eight of its last nine games; Xavier (20-10, 12-7) won six-straight games, including a 91-82 win over the Friars on Feb. 12 behind 23 points from Zach Freemantle, who is fifth in Big East scoring with 17.1 ppg.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Christopher Bell secured his first win of the season with his victory at Atlanta over Carson Hocevar, while Ryan Blaney leads the standings; William Byron averaged 85.224 mph to win the race last year, beating Bell by 0.692 seconds.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Brenden Queen kicked off his rookie campaign with a win in the season opener at Daytona over William Sawalich to gain an early three-point lead; Sawalich averaged 86.142 mph en route to his win at Phoenix last year over Giovanni Ruggiero.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Butler (13-17, 6-13) is 2-8 on the road; Creighton (21-9, 14-5) is 14-2 at home, and won five of its last six meetings with the Bulldogs after an 80-76 win on Jan. 11 behind 26 points from Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is second in Big East scoring.

programme.title: Fox College Hoops Tip-off
programme.desc: Expert analysts evaluate matchups and breakdown the upcoming college basketball game; coverage includes highlights of games from around the country, exclusive interviews with players and coaches, special features and human interest stories.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in third event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Abraham Ancer won the individual crown with a playoff victory over Paul Casey and Cameron Smith, while Crushers GC won the team title in last year's edition.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in third event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Abraham Ancer won the individual crown with a playoff victory over Paul Casey and Cameron Smith, while Crushers GC won the team title in last year's edition.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The #1 seed Connecticut goes up against the winner of #8 St. John's and #9 Butler for a place in the 2025 Big East semi-finals round on March 9; Connecticut won the 2024 Championship, beating Georgetown, 78-42, behind Paige Bueckers' 27 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Colorado State (21-9, 15-4) won six-straight games, and beat the Broncos, 75-72, on Jan. 22 behind 20 points from Nique Clifford; Boise State (22-8, 14-5) won five straight behind Tyson Degenhart, who is second in Mountain West scoring with 17.9 ppg.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 18 Purdue (21-9, 13-6) won its last two games after dropping the previous four, and won the last five meetings with the Fighting Illini, including a 77-71 road win last season; Illinois (19-11, 11-8) is 12-4 at home this season.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in Top Fuel, Pro Stock and Funny Car; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various categories.

programme.desc: Christopher Bell comes off back-to-back wins for the first time in his Cup Series career following his victory at Austin over William Byron; Bell averaged 103.568 mph en route to his win in the race last year, beating Chris Buescher by 5.465 seconds.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Day

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series

programme.desc: Creighton claimed a 70-57 victory over Villanova in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 8, led by a combined 48 points from Lauren Jensen and Morgan Maly; Jasmine Bascoe posted 21 points and 7 rebounds for the Wildcats in the loss.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.
